Class RuntimeDatabase

java.lang.Object
  RuntimeDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
SHPRCConstants
public class RuntimeDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements SHPRCConstants

SHPRC-POS RuntimeDatabase.java Stores back end information to be retrieved by the Purchase (Model in MVC class) at runtime and enables writes to the back end data base. Because the amount of data in the back end is small and largely read-only, runtime structures allow greater efficiency than directly querying the back end.

Version:
0.1 03/17/2013
Author:
Sophi Newman

Constructor Detail

RuntimeDatabase

public RuntimeDatabase()
                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Class constructor. Does not actually read in data and store it; instead, it ensures that the JDBC Class is successfully loaded.

Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

initRuntimeDatabase

public boolean initRuntimeDatabase()
Initializes the JDBC connection to the database and loads up the runtime data structures. Returns false if any of these initializations fail.

Returns:
successfully initialized

lookupClient

public Client lookupClient(int SUID)
Tests to see if the specified client exists in the client database. If so, the corresponding client object is created and returned to the user. If a client is not in the database, lookupClient returns null.

Parameters:
SUID -
Returns:
a client object retrieved from the database, if it exists
